comment: Terrible class and professor. I've heard a lot of people like him for Linear Algebra, but for Topology his class is awful. If you seek him for help outside class, he just tells you "you need to practice more," or "you should already know this." He's not pleased with proofs unless they are verbatim to what he wants. Stay away from this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Edwards is a very great teacher of the subject material and makes sure that we are learning by giving small quizzes throughout the units. If you pay attention during the lectures and practice the material through the homework youll do absolutely fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great guy. Easy to understand. I recommend reading the textbook beforehand and doing the hw to make the class a breeze. He gives study guides that tell you exactly what you need to know. 10/10

Dr. Edwards is a fantastic professor. His lectures are straight forward, and as long as you pay attention in class you will do fine in his class. Homework is straight out of the textbook and is optional, but I highly recommend doing it to do well in the class--especially since he gives short quizzes every other week. Overall great professor!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Nobody has any idea what he is teaching in class. It is honestly just a bunch of scribble on the whiteboard. He is impossible to please while writing proofs. He takes points off when you write it like the text book, but then takes points off when you don't. That being said, he is very smart I just don't think the communication skills are there.

I took him for proofs and was a ridiculously hard grader. If you don't write the proof "the way he would have" then it's wrong. If you try to write the proofs the same way the textbook has them, he then critiques the author. If you don't like the way author words the proofs, why would assign students to read it? Extremely hard teacher to please.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Taking him for linear algebra. He goes pretty fast sometimes but it's not hard to follow. He's always willing to answer questions and let's you know the date of test/quizzes ahead of time (he also list them on his website). Quizzes are short and at the end of class. If you just do the homework you're fine.

I wouldn't say the class is entirely difficult; you either get , kinda get, or are lost for the majority of the semester.  Edwards is a bit of a speedster when he runs through lecture; he's more than willing to answer, but people rarely ask questions - in fear that they'll look stupid. Whatever you do, DO NOT UNDERESTIMATE THE CLASS DIFFICULTY!
DON'T take him. I loved math till I took him I hate math. He will just solve examples from the book. He will not help if you ask him to help you, he will tell you "you need to practice more"

During lectures he talks and writes non-stop.  He does not pause for students to catch up and follow, thus you likely won't be able to keep up during lectures.  You will have to do homework every night to prepare for quizzes and tests.  The tests are 50 minutes so you have to be able to answer questions very quickly to be able to get an A or B.

I have him for calc 2 for fall 2014. Im not unhappy with my choice. Its a hard class regardless of the teacher. He gives frequent quizzes. As long as you do homework and understand it, youll ace them. Tests are difficult but very possible to do well on if you do the homework. He doesnt check it, but you need practice. Lectures are boring but clear

Good Teacher. Gives little partial credit, but considering that the problems you were assessed on were the easiest problems from the book it never really mattered. Quizzes are handed out often but just study the first few questions from the chapter and you'll be fun. He can be a little dry,but you'll definitely learn a lot from him. I recommend him

Professor Edwards is a decent teacher, but his tests are insanely hard. You will work the entire period to finish his tests. He is also not clear on how he give you your final grade: he says he will collect homework, but doesn't, and says he will drop quizzes, but not how many.

Had this professor for vector analysis, and I was very displeased. I really wanted to like Dr. Edwards, but he is so condescending, and makes you feel stupid any time you ask a question.  I resorted to not asking any questions at all. The book is USELESS and frustrating. Quiz questions come out of nowhere. Will be avoiding him at all costs.

Good teacher; good guy. He knows what he teaching and he can teach it. He'll give you unrelenting homework, and more often than not the homework will have questions with REALLY BS answers. He is an incredibly spiteful grader on tests. I've had answers that were word for word correct (he even agreed), but wouldn't give me credit for it.

Had the professor for Calc II. He isn't easy, atleast he wasn't for me, but he's extremely clear and lets students ask all the questions they want before he moves to lecture. Tests are fair, no curves, no drops-- but if you want to learn, take him. Very cool guy.

I am finishing up my semester w/ him as my Calc III professor and I have to say he is the best math teacher I have had at SPSU.  The book is not fully necessary if your someone who can learn from notes because his lecture is easy to follow and he will answer any question.  He uses visuals to explain 3D stuff.  Homework is not mandatory. No curves.

Pretty good teacher.  He doesn't give too many examples but the ones he does give are very clear and he works ALL the way through them.  Also draws very detailed pictures on the board which helps out alot.

A very good math prof. very clear on answering problems. BUT you will only learn how much u want to learn, he will do one problem on the board out of each section, after that it is up to u to ask questions to increase your learning, so if u are scared to ask Q's don't take him!!!

I don't suggest taking this teacher. His grading is unfair and he barely ever gives partial credit. He really isn't a nice guy either. I think he is possibly the WORST teacher I have ever had. It's up to you, but if you can't teach yourself math DO NOT take him.

Great teaching perspective.  If you do all the homework he gives you, you will understand and pass his class.  He doesn't grade the homework, either.  He gives his old tests as study guides the new ones.  Great teacher.
Great professor that knows his stuff. I'll highly recommend if you have taken other discreet courses & did not do well. You can't fail!

The first day I walked into class, he made it seem like he would be pretty leinent in his grading and he seemed like a guy who could explain well.  That all changed.  He goes really fast through lectures and topics, and doesnt give hardly any partial credit.  Nice guy, but (in my opinion) cannot teach very well.

USELSS & PATHETIC!  Grading unclear.. just penalizes you without any clear indication of why - you won't even know how many points a problem is worth.  His weak and pathetic teaching style is deplorable.  SPSU needs to have their accreditation revoke for keeping clueless, unresponsive professors like Edwards around. Don't take him!!
He is a very good teacher, explains things very well.  The tests are always very fair and the quizzes are always really simple, a good way to earn points.

I think he does a good job teaching calculus. He can get very confusing when he's explaining the really long, hard problems, but those are never on the tests so you don't have to understand them. I hardly studied or did homework and I would ace the tests, but there were a lot of people around me getting C's or worse. Study the old tests.

He is so anal in his grading. There is no grace for mistakes. Yes, hes helpful and knows his stuff, but his vast knowledge leads him to believe that everyone has to do everything methodically. I lost 10 points because I forgot to add a dy/dx on step 2 of a 6 step problem,and I had it from step 3 on.
Great teacher. Answered whatever question a student had no matter how dumb they may have been.

AWESOME TEACHER!!! He know what he is talking about and is a great teacher.  His test are fair you just have to know the material.  He does give some extra credit, but its not easy.  Overall, hes is a great calc teacher

The dude's okay. you have to do the homework to do good on quizzes.  if you wanna pass the tests, get the old ones he offers online, and have him go over every problem.  the majority of tests are the same.  definitley acts like a spaz.
